title: pictures app has a problem with folder names that contain spaces
body:
while traversing the file structure in the pictures app, spaces in the folder names are not being treated properly and the client is directed to a page that does not exist.

in the pictures app, if i attempt to navigate to an image that is located in sub-folders whose names contain spaces, this is what happens:

example folder structure:
/media - pictures/12-12-05 - cementing is fun/image1.jpg

1)  the original url for the pictures app is
http://[domain]/owncloud/?app=gallery

2)  selecting the "media - pictures" folder redirects the browser to 
http://[domain]/owncloud/?app=gallery&root=%2fmedia%20-%20pictures%2f
(correct)

3)  selecting the "12-12-05 - cementing is fun" folder redirects the browser to 
http://[domain]/owncloud/?app=gallery&root=%2fmedia%2b-%2bpictures%2f12-18-05%20-%20cementing%20is%20fun%2f
(wrong)

the problem is that the spaces (%20) in the parent directory are converted to + signs (%2b), even though they were treated properly in step 2.


the correct page is shown if i manually change the url in step 3 to

http://[domain]/owncloud/?app=gallery&root=%2fmedia%20-%20pictures%2f12-18-05%20-%20cementing%20is%20fun%2f
